intro: Heliomeris tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heliomeris, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy plant in arid or semi-arid environments. Heliomeris tenuifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
